Item.Label: Evidence-Based Selected Response
Item.Description: EBSR items combine two sets of stems and response options into a single item. Unlike MultipleChoice and Multi-Select item types, EBSR items cannot be displayed in horizontal or stacked layouts. EBSR items can only display response options vertically. For Smarter Balanced, the first part of an EBSR item is multiple choice where only one answer can be selected. In the second part, multiple answers may be selected though the instructions may specify a limit to the student. In the example below, the student is only expected to select one answer from the second part.

Item.Label: Equation
Item.Description: The Equation item response area consists of one or more entry boxes and an on-screen key panel containing mathematical characters. These items are 769 pixels wide or use 100% of the available response area width (whichever is smaller). The default height is 254 pixels. The item indicates which of 11 pre-defined layouts should be used for the math input key panel.

Item.Label: Extended Response
Item.Description: The response areas for Extended Response (ER) and Short Answer (SA) item types essentially have the same appearance. Extended Response (ER) areas accommodate more text than Short Answer response areas. You can configure the character limit for both item types.

Item.Label: Short Answer
Item.Description: The response areas for Extended Response (ER) and Short Answer (SA) item types essentially have the same appearance. Extended Response (ER) areas accommodate more text than Short Answer response areas. You can configure the character limit for both item types.

Item.Label: Grid Item
Item.Description: Smarter Balanced uses three variations of the Grid Item type, each with a distinct appearance and interaction mode.

Item.Label: Hot Text
Item.Description: The response area for Hot Text items consists of a section of text containing interactive words or phrases that students can either select (highlight) by clicking or rearrange by clicking and dragging.

Item.Label: Multiple Choice
Item.Description: For multiple choice responses, only one answer can be selected among several possibilities.

Item.Label: Multi Select
Item.Description: For the Multi Select (MS) option, students are given a number of items to select to answer the questions. For the example below, two of the listed items will be selected.

Item.Label: Matching Item
Item.Description: For the Match Interaction (MI) types, text or images in rows are matched values in columns. The student selects the boxes where a match is valid.

Item.Label: Table Item
Item.Description: For Table Interaction (TI) item types, students are provided with a table that includes a separate area of cells in which students may enter text.

Item.Label: Writing Extended Response
